title: Transitive dependency on local module via local extension fails to build
body:
### Describe the bug

Hi,

We have a Quarkus application that relies on a local Quarkus extension. This extension in turn declares a dependency on another local module that only builds a WebJar (and no Java sources). Such a setup seems to confuse the build process of Quarkus right now.

### Expected behavior

The project builds successfully. 

### Actual behavior

The project fails to build because `build/classes/java/main` does not exist for the local module:

```
> Task :opendc-web:opendc-web-api:quarkusGenerateCode FAILED
preparing quarkus application

FAILURE: Build failed with an exception.

* What went wrong:
Execution failed for task ':opendc-web:opendc-web-api:quarkusGenerateCode'.
> /Users/fabian/Documents/Workspace/Programming/JVM/quarkus-repro/opendc-web/opendc-web-ui-quarkus/deployment/build/classes/java/main does not exist

* Try:
> Run with --info or --debug option to get more log output.
> Run with --scan to get full insights.

* Exception is:
org.gradle.api.tasks.TaskExecutionException: Execution failed for task ':opendc-web:opendc-web-api:quarkusGenerateCode'.

```

### How to Reproduce?

**Dependency on empty local Java module**

1. Clone the following project: https://github.com/fabianishere/quarkus-repro/tree/master
2. Run `./gradlew build`

**Dependency on local non-Java module**

1. Clone the following project: https://github.com/fabianishere/quarkus-repro/tree/no-java-plugin
2. Run `./gradlew build`
